svcsubproc.para: In this configuration, the shutter assembly is mounted to the horsecollar front flange, and is located between the charge air cooler and the radiator assembly.
Refer to Figure 11for the following Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the hood to provide access to the shutter assembly (Item 6, Figure 11); refer to GROUP 16, CAB in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Disconnect the charge air cooler from the system air pipes at the intake and outlet tanks (Item 8); leave the charge air tubing in place on the tanks. Retain the clamps. Refer to CAUTION, below. .

caution.para: To prevent internal contamination of components, immediately cap the piping to the engine and to the charge air cooler intake and outlet tanks.

step1.para: Remove the charge air cooler from the brackets (Item 11) atop the horsecollar, and at the support spacers (Item 10). Retain all fasteners.

Remove the air supply line from the shutter control valve (Item 3), and from the air conditioning (if so equipped) override valve (Item 1) that is mounted on the horsecollar flange. Detach the supply line from the two cushioned clips (Item 4) on the rear of the horsecollar. Leave the supply hose (Item 2) in place on the horsecollar.

Remove the 5/16 - 18 x 1 flanged hex head bolts (Item 7) that secure the shutter assembly to the horsecollar through the recirculation shield (Item 5). Retain the bolts. Remove and dispose of the shutter assembly.
Assemble the new shutter assembly to the horsecollar with the hardware previously removed. Tighten the bolts to 155 - 190 in-lb (17.5 - 21.4 N•m).

Feed the air supply line under the radiator and secure it with the cushioned clips on the rear of the horsecollar. Assemble the air supply line to the shutter control valve, and to the air conditioning override valve (if so equipped).
Secure the charge air cooler to the brackets on the horsecollar, and at the support spacers. Tighten the bolts to 155 - 190 in-lb (17.5 - 21.4 N•m).

Remove the dust caps and connect the charge air cooler to the system piping. Connect the cooler tanks to the system piping with the clamps previously removed. Tighten the hose clamps to 70 - 75 in-lb (7.9 - 8.5 N•m).
Install the hood; refer to GROUP 16, CAB in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

important.para: Refer to GROUP 12, ENGINE - Charge Air Cooler in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for information on charge air coolers.

svcsubproc.para: In this configuration, the shutter assembly is mounted to the rear of the radiator assembly, and is located between the radiator assembly and the fan shroud.
Refer to Figure 12for the following Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Unlatch and open the hood. To provide access to the shutter assembly (Item 6, Figure 12), disconnect the hood retaining cables and support the hood at 90° to horizontal on an appropriate stand. Refer to GROUP 16, CAB in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
To provide access to the shutter mounting hardware, disconnect the charge air cooler at the intake and outlet tanks. Refer to CAUTION below .

caution.para: To prevent internal contamination of components, immediately cap the piping to the engine and to the charge air cooler intake and outlet tanks.

step1.para: Remove the air supply line (Item 2) from the air conditioning (if so equipped) override valve (Item 1). Reach through the fan shroud to remove the air supply from the shutter control valve (Item 4). Leave the air supply attached to the clip (Item 3) on the fan shroud.
Remove the 5/16 - 18 x 1 flanged hex head bolts that secure the fan shroud and the shutter assembly to the radiator. Retain the bolts. Remove the shroud. Remove and dispose of the shutter assembly.
Position the new shutter assembly and the fan shroud on the radiator. Secure the components with the hardware previously removed. Tighten the bolts to 155 - 190 in-lb (17.5 - 21.4 N•m).
Reach inside the shroud to assemble the air supply line to the shutter control valve. Attach air supply to the air conditioning (if so equipped) override valve.
Remove the dust caps from the cooler tubing and piping. Assemble the cooler intake and outlet. Tighten the hose clamps to 70 - 75 in-lb (7.9 - 8.5 N•m).
Connect the hood retaining cables. Refer to GROUP 16, CAB in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. Close and latch the hood.
